Player History
Injured on 4/17/1985 with a Strained Back, out for one week...
Injured on 3/25/1986 with a Torn Rib Cage Muscle, out for 8-9 weeks...
Injured on 8/14/1986 with a Pulled Hip Muscle, out for 5 days...
Had first career hit on 8/3/1987, off Zane Smith (LAD)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/10/1988, off Ron Davis (SD)...
Won World Series with New York (M) in 1989...
2/2/1990: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,078,571 through salary arbitration...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Philadelphia on 4/29/1990...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
2/2/1991: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,421,429 through salary arbitration...
Injured on 5/14/1991 with a Broken Foot, out for 10-11 weeks...
2/2/1992: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,421,429 through salary arbitration...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/5/1992, hitting .607 with 5 HR, 10 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Atlanta on 6/23/1992...
Was selected to the 1992 Allstar game...
7/26/1992: Signed a contract extension with New York (M), $6,180,000 per year, for 4 years.
Hit for the cycle against Atlanta on 8/22/1992...
Traded from New York (M) to Philadelphia on 5/26/1993 (Going to PHI: CF Lenny Dykstra. Going to NYM: 1B Bob Hamelin, 3B Dave Hollins, P Ron Darling)...
